inventory.commentary: 11Jun08 - split out senses 3,4,5 from sense 1 added features, update wn2.1 ahouston

sense.name: liquid hydrocarbon substance used as fuel, petroleum
sense.examples: Oil is $53.21 a barrel. What type of oil does that engine use, gasoline or diesel? This is an old fashioned lamp that burns oil. How often should you change the oil in your car? (derived from petroleum, used as lubricant)

sense.name: oil companies, collectively
sense.commentary: OIL[+entity][+organization][+industry][+petroleum] Refers to the petroleum industry in general
sense.examples: The President is taking contributions from big oil. The oil lobby has lot of power in the government. I invested my IRA in oil!

sense.name: a lubricant substance that protects or seals a surface
sense.examples: John rubbed the wood with linseed oil. The masseur offered his client a selection of scented oils for the massage. This moisturizer replenishes the natural oils of the skin. Mary applied a liberal dose of suntan oil before going to the beach.

sense.name: edible fatty acids derived from plants
sense.examples: Safflower oil is less saturated than coconut oil. This diet recommends lowering your intake of fats and oils. I fried the fish in vegetable oil.

sense.name: pigments used in art, painting
sense.examples: This seascape was painted in oil, and that one was painted in acrylics. The artist said she works mostly in oils.
